skill.summary: Run comprehensive quality checks including linting, type checking, tests, and security audits before...
skill.author: AI-Vibe-Prompts

security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation-only prompt file. It contains no executable code, scripts, or network calls. It defines workflows for running standard development tools (linters, type checkers, test runners) via Claude Code's native tools.

content.value_statement: Manual code quality checks slow down development and allow bugs to slip through. This skill automatically runs linting, type checking, tests, and security audits before every commit or deployment.
actual_capabilities: Runs linting with ESLint, Biome, or project-configured linter
Executes TypeScript type checking with tsc
Runs unit and integration tests with Vitest or Jest
Performs security audits via npm audit
Validates git commits for secrets and large files
Supports pre-commit, pre-push, and pre-deploy gate levels
limitations: Does not modify code automatically beyond auto-fix options
Requires project to have linting, testing, and build tools configured
Runs on local machine only, no cloud-based scanning
Cannot enforce gates without user or git hook integration

best_practices: Configure quality gates in package.json with lint, typecheck, and test scripts for consistent execution
Use Husky or similar git hooks to prevent bypassing quality gates accidentally
Set realistic coverage thresholds that encourage improvement without blocking development
anti_patterns: Skipping quality gates for 'quick fixes' that eventually become technical debt
Setting coverage thresholds too high causing developers to write tests for the sake of metrics
Ignoring lint warnings as they accumulate and create noise that hides real issues

faq.question: Which tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports ESLint, Biome for linting; tsc for TypeScript; Vitest, Jest, and Node.js native tests; npm/pnpm audit for security.

faq.question: How long do quality gates take?
faq.answer: Pre-commit gates take under 30 seconds. Pre-push gates take up to 2 minutes. Pre-deploy gates take up to 5 minutes.

faq.question: Can I skip gates for emergency fixes?
faq.answer: Yes, use git commit --no-verify to bypass hooks, but this is for emergencies only.

faq.question: Is my code sent to external services?
faq.answer: No. All checks run locally using your installed tools. npm audit may check remote vulnerability databases.

faq.question: What happens if a gate fails?
faq.answer: Gates run sequentially and stop at the first failure. The skill provides specific file locations and commands to fix issues.

faq.question: How is this different from Husky?
faq.answer: Husky runs existing scripts as git hooks. This skill orchestrates which gates to run and provides intelligent feedback and fixes.
